intro: Galium bovei, commonly known as Bove's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium bovei typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowering structure make it a distinctive yet often overlooked member of the Rubiaceae family.
